task_description: Facing the building to your North-East (approx. 40°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to inspect the building’s full vertical extent, so I should tilt up to see the roofline clearly before estimating height.
The task specifies the building is around 40° to the north-east, so I should rotate my view right to about 40° while keeping the upward pitch to capture the roofline for height estimation.
To estimate the building height accurately, I should tilt up to include the roof and upper floors in view while staying aligned at 40°.
The view snapped back to 0°N, so I need to rotate to 40°NE again (keeping the upward pitch) to frame the target building’s top for height estimation.
I need to avoid the heading/pitch reset and instead get a closer vantage point, so moving toward the building should help gauge floors and scale for height estimation.
I’m now facing ~103°E and need to reorient toward the target at ~40°NE, so I should rotate left to about 40° to bring the main building back into view.
I overshot to 297° and need to face ~40°NE, so rotating right by about 103° should align me with the target building.
To get to ~40°NE from 103°E, I should rotate left by about 63° to align with the building.
The easiest way to face ~40°NE from 297° is to rotate right to the preset 27° and then fine-tune to 40°.
From 90°E I need to face ~40°NE, so rotating left by 50° will align the camera with the target building.
There is a preset right rotation to exactly 40°, which matches the required NE heading toward the building.
The rotation controls are behaving unexpectedly, so I’ll directly set the heading to 40° to face the target building.
A preset option will rotate the view to exactly 40° (the required NE direction), so I should use it to lock onto the building.
I need to face 40°NE, so from 90° I should rotate left by 50° to align with the building and then estimate its height.
Since the interface offers an exact 'Look RIGHT' heading of 40°, I should rotate to that to face the target building.
Repeated relative rotations are flipping me between headings, so I will directly set a custom rotation to reach heading 40° from 90° (i.e., -50° yaw).
The target heading is explicitly available as 'Look RIGHT: 40°', so I should rotate right by 90° to face it.
I’m stuck oscillating between 90° and 310°; instead of rotating further, I will estimate based on the visible building mass—typical 4–5 story institutional block roughly 3.5 m per story plus roof.
